Ukraine hopes to find ways to unblock border with Poland this weekUkraine hopes to reach agreement with the new Polish government this week to end truck blockades at the countries' border crossings, Ukraine's deputy prime minister said on Thursday. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 13:58:19 GMT R45GX75GXVML5FKS5NEBWEAKGQ https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ukraine-hopes-find-ways-unblock-border-with-poland-this-week-2023-12-21/Reuters世界欧洲
Putin's would-be challenger denies link to former oil boss KhodorkovskyYekaterina Duntsova, who is seeking to run against Vladimir Putin in Russia's next presidential election, denied on Thursday that she was backed by a former oil boss who runs an opposition movement from abroad. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 13:52:55 GMT EBY772MFGJM2TB3TJZPG6VO33I https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/putins-would-be-challenger-denies-link-former-oil-boss-khodorkovsky-2023-12-21/Reuters世界欧洲
US, China top military officials spoke on Thursday -Pentagon statementThe chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff spoke to his Chinese counterpart on Thursday morning, his office said as the United States and China resumed military communications. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 13:50:21 GMT DSROI5A7NJNDLFJPMM566CRM6E https://www.reuters.com/world/us-china-top-military-officials-spoke-thursday-pentagon-statement-2023-12-21/Reuters世界
Parched Gaza residents praise water tasting 'like sugar' from EgyptFor Gaza resident Zaki Abu Sleyma the water now flowing into the devastated enclave from a desalination project in Egypt tastes "like sugar" after weeks of Israel's bombardment and siege left him and many others drinking unclean, brackish water. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 13:46:37 GMT NS4BB7ONQVJFVM2ZF6KTTRC4V4 https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/parched-gaza-residents-praise-water-tasting-like-sugar-egypt-2023-12-21/Reuters世界中东
Brazil police launch raids over Braskem's sinking ground havocBrazil's federal police on Thursday conducted raids as part of a probe into petrochemical producer Braskem's sinking ground havoc in the city of Maceio, which has forced about 60,000 people to be moved since 2018. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 13:38:48 GMT VM5QADGHSFKF5CVKPVQ3YW4BEE https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/brazil-police-launch-raids-over-braskems-sinking-ground-havoc-2023-12-21/Reuters世界美洲
Russia has fired 7,400 missiles, 3,700 Shahed drones in war so far, Kyiv saysRussia has launched about 7,400 missiles and 3,700 Shahed attack drones at targets in Ukraine during its 22-month-old invasion, Kyiv said on Thursday, illustrating the vast scale of Moscow's aerial assaults. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 13:10:58 GMT KMCFND6J5FLPTPPDWFROZ44J2I https://www.reuters.com/world/europe/ Russia-has-fired-7400-missiles-3700-shahed-drones-war-so-far-kyiv-says-2023-12-21/Reuters世界欧洲
Hungary's PM Orban criticises Ukraine's move to stop ex-president at borderUkraine's decision to prevent former president Petro Poroshenko from leaving the country earlier this month to meet Hungary's prime minister raises questions over Kyiv's European Union ambitions, Viktor Orban told a briefing on Thursday. Pakistan's Imran Khan still barred from vote after conviction appeal fails - lawyerPakistan's ex prime minister Imran Khan remained disqualified from contesting elections after a court rejected his plea to suspend an earlier conviction on Thursday, his lawyer said. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 12:33:04 GMT LZGUPF2BSBP2FKWOUQOJAUBOE https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/imran-khans-appeal-against-conviction-rejected-by-pakistan-court-lawyer-says-2023-12-21/Reuters世界亚太地区
Mexico's Sheinbaum spurs hope of more private investment in energy after Lopez ObradorThe favorite to be Mexico's next leader will likely be more open than her mentor President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador to private investment in energy in order to help fund her renewable power push at a time of tighter public finances, aides, officials and executives said. Thu, 21 Dec 2023 12:09:50 GMT 3V5FR3DKUZNWLL3LBVUOIPAB5Y https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/mexicos-sheinbaum-spurs-hope-more-private-investment-energy-after-lopez-obrador-2023-12-21/Dave Graham世界美洲

Explainer: How far could China-Philippines relations worsen?China and the Philippines have ramped up rhetoric on defending territorial claims in the South China Sea, despite both calling for dialogue to settle tensions over that strategic waterway.
